description:
Reagents - 

 

Basic cell culture media: respective to the cell line used and experimental design 

Distilled water: Invitrogen® UltraPure™ Distilled Water (catalog number 19977015) or equivalent product from other vendor.

Highthroughput (HT) Pro A or G 96 well plate or Spin Column (Chromatrap® HT ChIP-qPCR kit; catalog number 500161 or 500162 or 500163)

96-well collection plate: USA scientific® TempPlate non-skirted 96-well PCR plate natural (catalog number 1402-9596) or equivalent product from other vendor.

QIAquick™ PCR purification kit (Qiagen®; catalog number 28104) or equivalent product from other vendor.

Hypotonic Buffer (Chromatrap® HT ChIP-qPCR kit; catalog number 500161 or 500162 or 500163)

Digestion Buffer (Chromatrap® HT ChIP-qPCR kit; catalog number 500161 or 500162 or 500163)

Lysis Buffer (Chromatrap® HT ChIP-qPCR kit; catalog number 500161 or 500162 or 500163)

Column Conditioning Buffer (Chromatrap® HT ChIP-qPCR kit; catalog number 500161 or 500162  

or 500163)

Wash Buffer 1 (Chromatrap® HT ChIP-qPCR kit; catalog number 500161 or 500162 or 500163)

Wash Buffer 2 (Chromatrap® HT ChIP-qPCR kit; catalog number 500161 or 500162 or 500163)

Wash Buffer 3 (Chromatrap® HT ChIP-qPCR kit; catalog number 500161 or 500162 or 500163)

Elution Buffer (Chromatrap® HT ChIP-qPCR kit; catalog number 500161 or 500162 or 500163)

5M NaCl: dissolve 292g of NaCl in 800mL of H2O. Adjust the volume to 1L with H2O.

1M NaHCO3: dissolve 12.6g of NaHCO3 in 100 mL of H2O. Adjust the volume to 150 mL with H2O.

Protease Inhibitor Cocktail (PIC): Cell signaling Technology® (catalog number 5871) or equivalent product from other vendor.

Proteinase K: Qiagen® (catalog number 19133) or equivalent product from other vendor.

Proteinase K stop solution: 100mM Phenylmethylsulfonyl fluoride (PMSF). Weigh 1.742g PMSF (Sigma-Aldrich®, catalog number 10837091001) and add DMSO (Sigma-Aldrich®, catalog number D2650) to a final volume of 100mL. Dissolve completely.

PBS: HyClone™ Phosphate Buffered Saline (1X) (catalog number SH30256.01) or equivalent product from other vendor.

Formaldehyde: VWR® 37% w/w aqueous solution (catalog number 97064-604) or equivalent product from other vendor.

0.65M Glycine: Dissolve 488g of glycine into 1L of H2O to make 6.5M glycine (10X). Dilute with PBS to make 1X before each experiment.   

Micrococcal Nuclease: Cell Signaling Technologies® (catalog number 10011S) or equivalent product from other vendor.

1.3-1.5% Agarose gel: dissolve 1.3-1.5g of agarose powder into 100mL of TAE buffer by microwave heating. Visualize DNA under UV light by adding appropriate amount of Ethidium Bromide, or use an equivalent method.

Add appropriate amount of Ethidium Bromide to cooled down gel solution to visualize DNA under UV light.

0.5M EDTA: Dissolve 186.1g EDTA into 700mL of H2O. Adjust the volume to 1L with H2O.

100bp ladder: NEB® (catalog number N0467S) or equivalent product from other vendor.

 

Materials -

Heat block

Rotator

Centrifuge

Microcentrifuge

37ºC incubator

Nanodrop

Sonicator

UV light imager

Rocking platform

components.data: Culture between 1-15 million cells. Collect cells by spinning down at 500xg at 4ºC for 5 minutes. Wash cells with PBS at room temperature.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Culture between 1-15 million cells. Collect cells by spinning down at 500xg at 4ºC for 5 minutes. Wash cells with PBS at room temperature.

components.data: Chromatin Sample Preparation
components.name: Section

components.data: Remove the PBS and add freshly made basic cell culture media (it should not contain any serum or large molecular weight proteins to avoid any interferences from those proteins) containing1% formaldehyde (CH2O) to cross-link the DNA-protein complexes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove the PBS and add freshly made basic cell culture media (it should not contain any serum or large molecular weight proteins to avoid any interferences from those proteins) containing1% formaldehyde (CH2O) to cross-link the DNA-protein complexes.

components.data: Chromatin Sample Preparation
components.name: Section

components.data: Incubate for 10 minutes at room temperature with gentle agitation on a rocking platform.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate for 10 minutes at room temperature with gentle agitation on a rocking platform.

components.data: Chromatin Sample Preparation
components.name: Section

components.data: Remove the fixation solution by spinning down at 500xg at 4ºC for 5 minutes. To quench there action, for cell count of 1-5 million, add 3mL of 0.65M glycine solution; for cell count of 5-10million, add 4mL of 0.65M glycine solution; for cell count of 10-15 million, add 5mL of 0.65M glycine solution.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove the fixation solution by spinning down at 500xg at 4ºC for 5 minutes. To quench there action, for cell count of 1-5 million, add 3mL of 0.65M glycine solution; for cell count of 5-10million, add 4mL of 0.65M glycine solution; for cell count of 10-15 million, add 5mL of 0.65M glycine solution.

components.data: Chromatin Sample Preparation
components.name: Section

components.data: Incubate at room temperature for 5 minutes with gentle agitation on a rocking platform.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate at room temperature for 5 minutes with gentle agitation on a rocking platform.

components.data: Chromatin Sample Preparation
components.name: Section

components.data: Remove the glycine solution by spinning down at 500xg at 4ºC for 5 minutes. Discard thesupernatant. The pellet can be frozen at -80ºC after adding 1µL of Protease Inhibitor Cocktail (PIC).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove the glycine solution by spinning down at 500xg at 4ºC for 5 minutes. Discard thesupernatant. The pellet can be frozen at -80ºC after adding 1µL of Protease Inhibitor Cocktail (PIC).

components.data: Chromatin Sample Preparation
components.name: Section

components.data: To lyse the cells, for cell count of 1-5 million, add 0.4mL of Hypotonic Buffer; for cell count of 5-10 million, add 0.8mL of Hypotonic Buffer; for cell count of 10-15 million, add 1mL of HypotonicBuffer to the cell pellet. Resuspend the cells and incubate at 4ºC for 10 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: To lyse the cells, for cell count of 1-5 million, add 0.4mL of Hypotonic Buffer; for cell count of 5-10 million, add 0.8mL of Hypotonic Buffer; for cell count of 10-15 million, add 1mL of HypotonicBuffer to the cell pellet. Resuspend the cells and incubate at 4ºC for 10 minutes.

components.data: Chromatin Sample Preparation
components.name: Section

components.data: Centrifuge the hypotonic slurries at 5,000xg at 4ºC for 5 minutes to collect the nuclei.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge the hypotonic slurries at 5,000xg at 4ºC for 5 minutes to collect the nuclei.

components.data: Chromatin Sample Preparation
components.name: Section

components.data: For cell count of 1-5 million, add 0.3mL of Digestion Buffer; for cell count of 5-10 million, add 0.4mL of Digestion Buffer; for cell count of 10-15 million, add 0.5mL of Digestion Buffer to the nuclei, immediately followed by adding 2µL of PIC to each sample.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: For cell count of 1-5 million, add 0.3mL of Digestion Buffer; for cell count of 5-10 million, add 0.4mL of Digestion Buffer; for cell count of 10-15 million, add 0.5mL of Digestion Buffer to the nuclei, immediately followed by adding 2µL of PIC to each sample.

components.data: Chromatin Sample Preparation
components.name: Section

components.data: Add Micrococcal Nuclease to each sample to digest the DNA. Mix by inverting the tube severaltimes and incubate at 37ºC for 20 minutes. Mix by inversion every 3-5 minutes. The amount andincubation time of Micrococcal Nuclease required to digest the genomic DNA to an optimal 150900 bp length may need to be determined empirically for individual cell types.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add Micrococcal Nuclease to each sample to digest the DNA. Mix by inverting the tube severaltimes and incubate at 37ºC for 20 minutes. Mix by inversion every 3-5 minutes. The amount andincubation time of Micrococcal Nuclease required to digest the genomic DNA to an optimal 150900 bp length may need to be determined empirically for individual cell types.

components.data: Chromatin Sample Preparation
components.name: Section

components.data: Stop digestion by adding 10µL of 0.5M EDTA per sample and place the sample on ice.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Stop digestion by adding 10µL of 0.5M EDTA per sample and place the sample on ice.

components.data: Chromatin Sample Preparation
components.name: Section

components.data: Pellet nuclei by centrifugation at 12,000xg at 4ºC for 1 minute. Discard the supernatant.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pellet nuclei by centrifugation at 12,000xg at 4ºC for 1 minute. Discard the supernatant.

components.data: Chromatin Sample Preparation
components.name: Section

components.data: Resuspend nuclear pellet in Lysis Buffer and incubate the sample on ice for 10 minutes to lyse the nuclei. Alternatively, sonicate to shear the DNA. The time and strength for sonication may need to be determined empirically.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Resuspend nuclear pellet in Lysis Buffer and incubate the sample on ice for 10 minutes to lyse the nuclei. Alternatively, sonicate to shear the DNA. The time and strength for sonication may need to be determined empirically.

components.data: Chromatin Sample Preparation
components.name: Section

components.data: Centrifuge the sample at 16,000xg at 4ºC for 10 minutes. Transfer the supernatant to a clean dry microcentrifuge tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge the sample at 16,000xg at 4ºC for 10 minutes. Transfer the supernatant to a clean dry microcentrifuge tube.

components.data: Chromatin Sample Preparation
components.name: Section

components.data: Add 1µL of PIC to each sample and mix.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 1µL of PIC to each sample and mix.

components.data: Chromatin Sample Preparation
components.name: Section

components.data: Chromatin sample is now ready for ChIP Assay. If the sample is not to be used immediately,store at -80ºC. It is recommended that the shearing efficiency is analyzed at this stage to ensurethat 150-900bp fragments are obtained during shearing the DNA to increase the ChIP efficiency.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Chromatin sample is now ready for ChIP Assay. If the sample is not to be used immediately,store at -80ºC. It is recommended that the shearing efficiency is analyzed at this stage to ensurethat 150-900bp fragments are obtained during shearing the DNA to increase the ChIP efficiency.

components.data: Chromatin Sample Preparation
components.name: Section

components.data: Take 50µL aliquot of sheared chromatin from each sample into a new microcentrifuge. Add 5µLof 1M NaHCO3, 5µL of 5M NaCl and 50µL of Distilled Water. Mix thoroughly and incubate at 65ºC (heat block) for two hours or incubation can be extended for overnight.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Take 50µL aliquot of sheared chromatin from each sample into a new microcentrifuge. Add 5µLof 1M NaHCO3, 5µL of 5M NaCl and 50µL of Distilled Water. Mix thoroughly and incubate at 65ºC (heat block) for two hours or incubation can be extended for overnight.

components.data: Addendum: Shearing Efficiency Analysis
components.name: Section

components.data: Remove the sample from heat block, add 1µL of Proteinase K to each sample, vortex briefly and perform a spin down at 500xg at 4ºC for 5 minutes. Incubate at 37ºC for one hour.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove the sample from heat block, add 1µL of Proteinase K to each sample, vortex briefly and perform a spin down at 500xg at 4ºC for 5 minutes. Incubate at 37ºC for one hour.

components.data: Addendum: Shearing Efficiency Analysis
components.name: Section

components.data: Add 2µL of Proteinase K Stop Solution to each sample, vortex briefly and perform a short spindown.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 2µL of Proteinase K Stop Solution to each sample, vortex briefly and perform a short spindown.

components.data: Addendum: Shearing Efficiency Analysis
components.name: Section

components.data: Purify the DNA by QIAquick™ PCR purification kit, according to manufacturer’s manual.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Purify the DNA by QIAquick™ PCR purification kit, according to manufacturer’s manual.

components.data: Addendum: Shearing Efficiency Analysis
components.name: Section

components.data: Quantify the DNA in the sample using a Nanodrop. This will be used to determine the volume ofchromatin to load in ChIP assay.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Quantify the DNA in the sample using a Nanodrop. This will be used to determine the volume ofchromatin to load in ChIP assay.

components.data: Addendum: Shearing Efficiency Analysis
components.name: Section

components.data: To ensure 150-900bp fragments have been obtained during shearing the DNA, run each DNAsample on a 1.3-1.5% agarose gel and visualize against a marker of known size DNA fragments(e.g., 100bp ladder).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: To ensure 150-900bp fragments have been obtained during shearing the DNA, run each DNAsample on a 1.3-1.5% agarose gel and visualize against a marker of known size DNA fragments(e.g., 100bp ladder).

components.data: Addendum: Shearing Efficiency Analysis
components.name: Section

components.data: Mix the Chromatin Sample, Protease Inhibitor Cocktail (PIC), optimal quantity of BioLegend’sGo-ChIP-GradeTM Purified antibodies and add Column Conditioning Buffer to make final 1mL slurries. Gently rotate at 4ºC for one hour or incubation can also be extended to overnight.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Mix the Chromatin Sample, Protease Inhibitor Cocktail (PIC), optimal quantity of BioLegend’sGo-ChIP-GradeTM Purified antibodies and add Column Conditioning Buffer to make final 1mL slurries. Gently rotate at 4ºC for one hour or incubation can also be extended to overnight.

components.data: Chromatin Immunoprecipitation Assay
components.name: Section

components.data: Prepare the high-throughput (HT) Protein A or G 96 well plate or Spin Column by adding 600µLof Column Conditioning Buffer in each well or column and allow it to flow through via gravity (~15minutes).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Prepare the high-throughput (HT) Protein A or G 96 well plate or Spin Column by adding 600µLof Column Conditioning Buffer in each well or column and allow it to flow through via gravity (~15minutes).

components.data: Chromatin Immunoprecipitation Assay
components.name: Section

components.data: Discard the flow-through and repeat steps 2 and 3.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Discard the flow-through and repeat steps 2 and 3.

components.data: Chromatin Immunoprecipitation Assay
components.name: Section

components.data: Remove the slurries from the rotator following 4ºC incubation and briefly spin down to remove residual liquid from the caps.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove the slurries from the rotator following 4ºC incubation and briefly spin down to remove residual liquid from the caps.

components.data: Chromatin Immunoprecipitation Assay
components.name: Section

components.data: Load the entire 1mL slurries and allow to flow completely through the high-throughput (HT)Protein A or G 96 well plate or Spin Column at room temperature (approximate 15-20 minutes).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Load the entire 1mL slurries and allow to flow completely through the high-throughput (HT)Protein A or G 96 well plate or Spin Column at room temperature (approximate 15-20 minutes).

components.data: Chromatin Immunoprecipitation Assay
components.name: Section

components.data: Add 600µL of Wash Buffer 1 to each well or column and centrifuge at 2000xg for plate, or 4000xgfor column, for one minute at room temperature. Discard the flow through and repeat once.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 600µL of Wash Buffer 1 to each well or column and centrifuge at 2000xg for plate, or 4000xgfor column, for one minute at room temperature. Discard the flow through and repeat once.

components.data: Chromatin Immunoprecipitation Assay
components.name: Section

components.data: Add 600µL of Wash Buffer 2 to each well or column and centrifuge at 2000xg for plate, or 4000xg for column, for one minute at room temperature. Discard the flow through and repeat once.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 600µL of Wash Buffer 2 to each well or column and centrifuge at 2000xg for plate, or 4000xg for column, for one minute at room temperature. Discard the flow through and repeat once.

components.data: Chromatin Immunoprecipitation Assay
components.name: Section

components.data: Add 600µL of Wash Buffer 3 to each well or column and centrifuge at 2000xg for plate, or 4000xgfor column, for one minute at room temperature. Discard the flow through and repeat once.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 600µL of Wash Buffer 3 to each well or column and centrifuge at 2000xg for plate, or 4000xgfor column, for one minute at room temperature. Discard the flow through and repeat once.

components.data: Chromatin Immunoprecipitation Assay
components.name: Section

components.data: Spin dry at 4,000xg for the plate or 16,000xg for the column for one minute at room temperature to remove any remaining liquid from the membrane of the plate or column. Place a clean 96 well collection plate or a collection tube beneath the plate or column.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Spin dry at 4,000xg for the plate or 16,000xg for the column for one minute at room temperature to remove any remaining liquid from the membrane of the plate or column. Place a clean 96 well collection plate or a collection tube beneath the plate or column.

components.data: Chromatin Immunoprecipitation Assay
components.name: Section

components.data: Add 50µL of Elution Buffer to each well or column. Incubate at room temperature for 15 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 50µL of Elution Buffer to each well or column. Incubate at room temperature for 15 minutes.

components.data: Chromatin Immunoprecipitation Assay
components.name: Section

components.data: Centrifuge the plate or column at 4,000xg for the plate, or 16,000xg for the column, for one minute at room temperature to collect the eluted chromatin-protein complex.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge the plate or column at 4,000xg for the plate, or 16,000xg for the column, for one minute at room temperature to collect the eluted chromatin-protein complex.

components.data: Chromatin Immunoprecipitation Assay
components.name: Section

components.data: To each eluted sample, add 5µL of 1M NaHCO3, 5µL of 5M NaCl and 50µL of Distilled Water. Mixthoroughly and incubate at 65ºC on the heat block for two hours or the incubation time can be extended to overnight.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: To each eluted sample, add 5µL of 1M NaHCO3, 5µL of 5M NaCl and 50µL of Distilled Water. Mixthoroughly and incubate at 65ºC on the heat block for two hours or the incubation time can be extended to overnight.

components.data: Chromatin Immunoprecipitation Assay
components.name: Section

components.data: Remove the sample from the heat block, add 1µL of Proteinase K to each sample, vortex briefly andperform a short spin down. Incubate at 37ºC for one hour.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove the sample from the heat block, add 1µL of Proteinase K to each sample, vortex briefly andperform a short spin down. Incubate at 37ºC for one hour.

components.data: Chromatin Immunoprecipitation Assay
components.name: Section

components.data: Add 2µL of Proteinase K Stop Solution to each sample, vortex briefly and perform a short spin down.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 2µL of Proteinase K Stop Solution to each sample, vortex briefly and perform a short spin down.

components.data: Chromatin Immunoprecipitation Assay
components.name: Section

components.data: Purify the DNA by QIAquick™ PCR purification kit, according to manufacturer’s manual. Purified DNA is ready for downstream real-time qPCR analysis.
components.name: Description
